alert.note: Alert for Hoopa; Interior Mendocino; Lake County Portion of Lake-Napa-Sonoma Unit; North Coast; Trinity; Van Duzen, Mad River; W Mendocino NF, E Mendocino Unit (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 28 at 9:40AM PDT until October 29 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected This Weekend... .An exceptionally dry airmass will spread south across Northern California this weekend. In addition, east-northeast winds gusting from 30 to 50 mph are forecast to develop across the ridges of Northwest California. The dry air and strong winds will yield a critical fire weather threat through Sunday afternoon, particularly from southern Trinity County south across Lake and eastern Mendocino Counties. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT SUNDAY... * AFFECTED AREA...Portions of fire weather zones 201, 211, 212, 264, 276, 277, and 283. * WIND...East-northeast winds gusting from 30 to 50 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity values in the teens with very poor overnight recoveries. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
